Any plans of submitting new Torque releases in Fedora repository?
I'm working on it, currently i'm having issues with drmaa abstraction layer which doesn't compile with 4.2.6.
I expect no one actually uses the drmaa stuff - it's kind of dead idea I thought.

Haïkel - let me know if you'd like someone else to take a look a the build issue.

Steve - I wouldn't be so sure - at least on the Gridengine lists there is a steady stream of drmaa related posts.

torque-4.2.8-1.fc21 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 21.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/torque-4.2.8-1.fc21

Package torque-4.2.8-1.fc21:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora 21 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=updates-testing torque-4.2.8-1.fc21'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2014-10153/torque-4.2.8-1.fc21
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
torque-4.2.8-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
